1.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

2.text: How long wilt thou speak these things? And how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a mighty wind?

3.text: Doth God pervert justice? Or doth the Almighty pervert righteousness?

4.text: If thy children have sinned against him, And he hath delivered them into the hand of their transgression;

5.text: If thou wouldest seek diligently unto God, And make thy supplication to the Almighty;

6.text: If thou wert pure and upright: Surely now he would awake for thee, And make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.

7.text: And though thy beginning was small, Yet thy latter end would greatly increase.

8.text: For inquire, I pray thee, of the former age, And apply thyself to that which their fathers have searched out

9.text: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, Because our days upon earth are a shadow);

10.text: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, And utter words out of their heart?

11.text: Can the rush grow up without mire? Can the flag grow without water?

12.text: Whilst it is yet in its greenness, and not cut down, It withereth before any other herb.

13.text: So are the paths of all that forget God; And the hope of the godless man shall perish:

14.text: Whose confidence shall break in sunder, And whose trust is a spiderâ€™s web.

15.text: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: He shall hold fast thereby, but it shall not endure.

16.text: He is green before the sun, And his shoots go forth over his garden.

17.text: His roots are wrapped about the stone-heap, He beholdeth the place of stones.

18.text: If he be destroyed from his place, Then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.

19.text: Behold, this is the joy of his way; And out of the earth shall others spring.

20.text: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, Neither will he uphold the evil-doers.

21.text: He will yet fill thy mouth with laughter, And thy lips with shouting.

22.text: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; And the tent of the wicked shall be no more.
